Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Seal impression
Description: Impression of a seal applied on papyrus. This one is preserved best because it was not necessary to break the seal in order to open the document. Two red crowns of Low Egypt are depicted facing each other, surmounting the sign of gold and framed by signs of life.
